issue.title: Picnic failing constant time tests
issue.body:
In preparation for the 0.7.2 release, I ran the Valgrind constant time tests. Picnic is failing them. It seems all Picnic variants fail.  We previously had suppression files in `tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic` and `.../picnic3` but something must have changed in the Picnic implementation that makes those suppressions no longer match.
[failures.txt](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/files/9264526/failures.txt)


To reproduce:
```bash
docker run -dti openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 /bin/bash
docker attach (output of docker run command)
cd
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DOQS_OPT_TARGET=generic -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME=ON ..
ninja
cd ..
SKIP_ALGS='BIKE*,Classic*,Frodo*,HQC*,Kyber*,NTRU*,stru*,ntru*,LightSaber,Saber,FireSaber,Dilithium*,Falcon*,Rainbow*,SPHINCS*' python3 tests/test_constant_time.py  --verbose
```

This yields the output in the attached file, with a few excerpts below

## Example for picnic_L1_FS

```
. > valgrind --tool=memcheck --gen-suppressions=all --error-exitcode=1 --max-stackframe=20480000 --num-callers=20 --suppressions=tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic ./build/tests/test_sig picnic_L1_FS
==4665== Memcheck, a memory error detector
==4665== Copyright (C) 2002-2017, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.
==4665== Using Valgrind-3.15.0 and LibVEX; rerun with -h for copyright info
==4665== Command: ./build/tests/test_sig picnic_L1_FS
==4665== 
==4665== Thread 2:
==4665== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==4665==    at 0x115EF0: oqs_sig_picnic_picnic_impl_sign (picnic_impl.c:1146)
==4665==    by 0x1111C6: oqs_sig_picnic_sign (picnic.c:251)
==4665==    by 0x10F6E5: common_picnic_sign (sig_picnic.c:97)
==4665==    by 0x10F8F3: OQS_SIG_picnic_L1_FS_sign (sig_picnic.c:149)
==4665==    by 0x10F3EA: OQS_SIG_sign (sig.c:872)
==4665==    by 0x10D1A3: sig_test_correctness (test_sig.c:95)
==4665==    by 0x10D718: test_wrapper (test_sig.c:179)
==4665==    by 0x4B30608: start_thread (pthread_create.c:477)
==4665==    by 0x4C6A132: clone (clone.S:95)
==4665== 
{
   <insert_a_suppression_name_here>
   Memcheck:Cond
   fun:oqs_sig_picnic_picnic_impl_sign
   fun:oqs_sig_picnic_sign
   fun:common_picnic_sign
   fun:OQS_SIG_picnic_L1_FS_sign
   fun:OQS_SIG_sign
   fun:sig_test_correctness
   fun:test_wrapper
   fun:start_thread
   fun:clone
}
```

issue.title: Dilithium AVX failing constant time tests
issue.body:
In preparation for the 0.7.2 release, I ran the Valgrind constant time tests. Dlithium's AVX code is failing them. We previously had suppression files in `tests/constant_time/kem/passes/dilithium*` but something must have changed in the Dliithium implementation that makes those suppressions no longer match.

To reproduce:
```bash
docker run -dti openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 /bin/bash
docker attach (output of docker run command)
cd
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DOQS_OPT_TARGET=generic -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME=ON ..
cmake -GNinja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME=ON ..
ninja
cd ..
SKIP_ALGS='BIKE*,Classic*,Frodo*,HQC*,Kyber*,NTRU*,sntru*,ntru*,LightSaber,Saber,FireSaber,Falcon*,picnic*,Rainbow*,SPHINCS*' python3 tests/test_constant_time.py  --verbose
```

This yields the output in the attached file [dilithium_failures.txt](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/files/9264650/dilithium_failures.txt), with a few excerpts below:

```
. > valgrind --tool=memcheck --gen-suppressions=all --error-exitcode=1 --max-stackframe=20480000 --num-callers=20 --suppressions=tests/constant_time/sig/passes/dilithium --suppressions=tests/constant_time/sig/passes/dilithium-avx2 --suppressions=tests/constant_time/sig/passes/dilithium-aarch64 ./build/tests/test_sig Dilithium2
==13982== Memcheck, a memory error detector
==13982== Copyright (C) 2002-2017, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.
==13982== Using Valgrind-3.15.0 and LibVEX; rerun with -h for copyright info
==13982== Command: ./build/tests/test_sig Dilithium2
==13982== 
==13982== Thread 2:
==13982== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
```

issue.title: cmake file installed in wrong location: /usr/lib64/cmake/usr/lib64oqs/liboqsConfig.cmake
issue.body:
I tested `0.7.2-rc1` and cmake files, such as `liboqsConfig.cmake`, are installed in `/usr/lib64/cmake/usr/lib64oqs`:
```
+ DESTDIR=/usr/src/tmp/liboqs-buildroot
+ /usr/bin/ninja -j20 install -C build
...
-- Installing: /usr/src/tmp/liboqs-buildroot/usr/lib64/cmake/usr/lib64oqs/liboqsConfig.cmake
-- Installing: /usr/src/tmp/liboqs-buildroot/usr/lib64/cmake/usr/lib64oqs/liboqsConfigVersion.cmake
...
-- Installing: /usr/src/tmp/liboqs-buildroot/usr/lib64/cmake/usr/lib64oqs/liboqsTargets.cmake
-- Installing: /usr/src/tmp/liboqs-buildroot/usr/lib64/cmake/usr/lib64oqs/liboqsTargets-relwithdebinfo.cmake
```
